title: Reading Strategies and Comprehension

vocab.definition: A conclusion you reach based on evidence and reasoning
Hints in the text that help you understand unknown words
To retell the main points in your own words
To create pictures in your mind while reading
A smart guess about what will happen next based on clues
Words or details from the text that support your answer
What the text is mostly about
A fact or example that explains or proves the main idea
A link you make from the text to your life, another text, or the world
What you already know that helps you understand the text
To restate part of the text in your own words
What something is mostly about; a thought or point
A connection you make between the text and your own life

teachingNotes: Teach active reading strategies like questioning, predicting, and connecting to prior knowledge. Practice using context clues to determine word meanings. Focus on making inferences from text evidence.
